titles.title: Dǝrsan maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily” / Mälkǝʾa mädḫane ʿaläm “Image of the Saviour of the World”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dǝrsan maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily” (fols. 3ra) I-1) Introductory prayer (fol.3ra-va) I-2) Reading for Monday, Compline (nǝwam) (fols. 3va-18ra) I-3) Reading for Tuesday, Matins (mänfäqä lelit) (fols.18ra-31vb) I-4) Reading for Wednesday, Lauds (nägh) (fols. 31vb-42rb) I-5) Reading for Thursday, Terce (śälästu säʿat) (fols. 42rb-55rb) I-6) Reading for Friday, Sext (qätr) (fols. 55rb-67va) I-7) Reading for Saturday, None (täsaʿtu säʿat) (fols. 67va-79va) I-8) Reading for Sunday, Vespers (śärk) (fols. 79va-94va) II) Mälkǝʾa mädḫane ʿaläm “Image of the Saviour of the World” (fols. 94vb-100rb).

donors.donor: A few names are mentioned in the supplication formulas: Gäbrä Maryam (e.g., fols. 3va, 18rb, 30ra, 39rb, 40va, 77vb, 89rb), his mother Wälättä Ḥǝywät (e.g., fols. 8vb, 31vb, 65va), his wife Wälättä Yoḥannǝs (e.g., fols. 12ra, 29ra, 38ra, 42rb, 55rb, 76va, 89rb), his late father ʾabunä Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ (fols. 49rb, 83ra, 89rb), and his children Gäbrä Yoḥannǝs and Wälättä Tǝnśaʾe (fol. 87va). Most of the names are repeated in the concluding supplication formula (fol. 94va).

dcomments.dcomment: First late 19th or the first half of the 20th century (?).

txstates.txstate: The sewing is destroyed. Fols. 60, 61, 66, 67, 78, 79, 82, 83 are of smaller size. Holes are carefully amended in fols. 5, 15, 32, 49.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: triple line fillet, double line fillet, small x, triple sine wave, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(10; s.l.: 1, stub after 9; 10, stub before 1/fols. 59r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XII(8/fols. 93r-100v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Late 19th or the first half of the 20th cent.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Text II is written in smaller script.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the donors (often only the second component); incipit of Texts I and II; title of Text I-2; incipit of the sections of the daily readings (homilies, absolution prayers, miracles and ʾarke); selected words or parts of words in ʾarke; words “sälam” and “sǝbḥat” in Text II; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I; a few groups of lines of the incipit of Texts I-2 to I-8. The first and the last letters or every second letter are rubricated in the nomina sacra on fols. 29vb, 50rb, 61ra, 69rab, 83rb.

extras.extra: - Omitted letters and words are written interlineally in the main hand, often in red ink: fols. 5ra, 14vb, 15ra, 16rb, 24ra, 31rb, 36ra, 36va, 40ra, 41va, 43ra, 45va, 49ra, 51ra, 51vb, 53ra, 54vab, 55ra, 55vb, 59ra, 69rb, 71rab, 78ra, 82va, 86vb, 90rb, 94ra. - Erasures: fols. 23vb, 28ra, 78ra. - A few spaces for rubrication are left unfilled on fols. 41ra-42rb. - Scribbles, doodles: fols. 1rv, 2rv, 3r, 4r, 5r, 6r, 7v, 8r, 18ra, 20r, 29v, 38r, 42r, 50v, 51r, 68r, 100v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in upper margin, encircled with alternating red and black dots, in the main hand: ዘሰሉስ: fol. 18ra ዘረቡዕ: fol. 31vb ዘሐሙስ: fol. 42rb ዘዓርብ: fol. 55rb ዘቀዳም: fol. 67va ዘዕሑድ: fol. 79va.
